page.title: 16Ugley Green
page.content: Ugley Green is located midway between Elsenham railway station and what was once the notorious A11 (re-classified since the M11 was completed as a B road). The M11 passes just east of Ugley Green but doesn't disturb this picturesque hamlet of residences that remind us of former times. Many of the homes here are thatched cottages and one cannot help but feel that it has hardly changed for many years. The village pump still stands on the green. Beside it is a great boulder of pudding stone which is beleived was used as a sign post in the times past by people travelling through the forest and up the hill. In one of the cottages on the green live Olive and Aurthur Dix. They are brother and sister and the cottage has been in their family since
